### isBigEndian() {#aad6842fbf58844d974611a4915a00aae}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static std::optional&lt; bool &gt; isBigEndian (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldensemap">SmallDenseMap</a>&lt; int64&#95;t, int64&#95;t, 8 &gt; &amp; MemOffset2Idx, int64&#95;t LowestIdx)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given a map from byte offsets in memory to indices in a load/store, determine if that map corresponds to a little or big endian byte pattern.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="MemOffset2Idx">maps memory offsets to address offsets.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="LowestIdx">is the lowest index in <code>MemOffset2Idx</code>.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the map corresponds to a big endian byte pattern, false if it corresponds to a little endian byte pattern, and std::nullopt otherwise.
</SectionUser>

E.g. given a 32-bit type x, and x&#91;AddrOffset&#93;, the in-memory byte patterns are as follows:

AddrOffset Little endian Big endian 0 0 3 1 1 2 2 2 1 3 3 0

<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Given a map from byte offsets in memory to indices in a load/store,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// determine if that map corresponds to a little or big endian byte pattern.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param MemOffset2Idx maps memory offsets to address offsets.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param LowestIdx is the lowest index in \\p MemOffset2Idx.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\returns true if the map corresponds to a big endian byte pattern, false if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it corresponds to a little endian byte pattern, and std::nullopt otherwise.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/amdgpucombinerhelper/#ab45ce737b2839bf39a18e22fbb502ca9"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// E.g. given a 32-bit type x, and x&#91;AddrOffset&#93;, the in-memory byte patterns</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AddrOffset   Little endian    Big endian</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 0            0                3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1            1                2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2            2                1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3            3                0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::optional&lt;bool&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="#aad6842fbf58844d974611a4915a00aae"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#aad6842fbf58844d974611a4915a00aae">isBigEndian</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldensemap">SmallDenseMap&lt;int64&#95;t, int64&#95;t, 8&gt;</a> &amp;MemOffset2Idx,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">            int64&#95;t LowestIdx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Need at least two byte positions to decide on endianness.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Width = MemOffset2Idx.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemapbase/#a3d95cc2d359b8d9ed5bd9504b44930b5">size</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Width &lt; 2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BigEndian = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, LittleEndian = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemOffset = 0; MemOffset &lt; Width; ++ MemOffset) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemOffsetAndIdx = MemOffset2Idx.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemapbase/#a0c047f127ed4380a6f383d70bec4eb94">find</a>(MemOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MemOffsetAndIdx == MemOffset2Idx.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemapbase/#a65520b9c67759099e313d0f4e7b5ff9e">end</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> int64&#95;t Idx = MemOffsetAndIdx-&gt;second - LowestIdx;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">    LittleEndian &amp;= Idx == <a href="#af36685438b34780c1b4612f8f7ae1e66">littleEndianByteAt</a>(Width, MemOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">    BigEndian &amp;= Idx == <a href="#a7bbce253a42111c59c6d5a9c89763697">bigEndianByteAt</a>(Width, MemOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!BigEndian &amp;&amp; !LittleEndian)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As bizarre as it may look, shuffle vector can actually produce</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scalar! This is because at the IR level a &lt;1 x ty&gt; shuffle</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vector is perfectly valid.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DstNumElts = DstType.isVector() ? DstType.getNumElements() : 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SrcNumElts = SrcType.isVector() ? SrcType.getNumElements() : 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the resulting vector is smaller than the size of the source</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vectors being concatenated, we won&#39;t be able to replace the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// shuffle vector into a concat&#95;vectors.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: We may still be able to produce a concat&#95;vectors fed by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       extract&#95;vector&#95;elt and so on. It is less clear that would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       be better though, so don&#39;t bother for now.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the destination is a scalar, the size of the sources doesn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// matter. we will lower the shuffle to a plain copy. This will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// work only if the source and destination have the same size. But</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that&#39;s covered by the next condition.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: If the size between the source and destination don&#39;t match</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       we could still emit an extract vector element in that case.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DstNumElts &lt; 2 &#42; SrcNumElts &amp;&amp; DstNumElts != 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that the shuffle mask can be broken evenly between the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// different sources.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DstNumElts % SrcNumElts != 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Mask length is a multiple of the source vector length.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if the shuffle is some kind of concatenation of the input</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vectors.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumConcat = DstNumElts / SrcNumElts;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;int, 8&gt;</a> ConcatSrcs(NumConcat, -1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;int&gt;</a> Mask = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOperand(3).getShuffleMask();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i != DstNumElts; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx = Mask&#91;i&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Undef value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Idx &lt; 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ensure the indices in each SrcType sized piece are sequential and that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same source is used for the whole piece.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((Idx % SrcNumElts != (i % SrcNumElts)) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">        (ConcatSrcs&#91;i / SrcNumElts&#93; &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">         ConcatSrcs&#91;i / SrcNumElts&#93; != (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)(Idx / SrcNumElts)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remember which source this index came from.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">    ConcatSrcs&#91;i / SrcNumElts&#93; = Idx / SrcNumElts;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The shuffle is concatenating multiple vectors together.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Collect the different operands for that.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> UndefReg;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Src2 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOperand(2).getReg();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Src : ConcatSrcs) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We permit the extend to hoist through basic blocks but this is only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Try to match the following:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bb1:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   G&#95;BRCOND %c1, %bb2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   G&#95;BR %bb3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bb2:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bb3:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The above pattern does not have a fall through to the successor bb2, always</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// resulting in a branch no matter which path is taken. Here we try to find</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and replace that pattern with conditional branch to bb3 and otherwise</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fallthrough to bb2. This is generally better for branch predictors.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getParent();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2765"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2766"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Handle a case like this:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2767"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2768"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %0:&#95;(s64), %1:&#95;(s64) = G&#95;UNMERGE&#95;VALUES %2:&#95;(&lt;2 x s64&gt;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2769"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2770"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Even though %0 and %1 are produced by the same instruction they are not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2771"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same values.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2772"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (I1 == I2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2773"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MOP1.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#ac0035d7c1c860501c877c20e6e93297b">getReg</a>() == MOP2.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#ac0035d7c1c860501c877c20e6e93297b">getReg</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2774"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2775"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have an instruction which loads or stores, we can&#39;t guarantee that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2776"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it is identical.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2777"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2778"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, we may have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2779"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2780"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %x1 = G&#95;LOAD %addr (load N from @somewhere)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2781"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2782"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// call @foo</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2783"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2784"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %x2 = G&#95;LOAD %addr (load N from @somewhere)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2785"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2786"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %or = G&#95;OR %x1, %x2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2787"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2788"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s possible that @foo will modify whatever lives at the address we&#39;re</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2789"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loading from. To be safe, let&#39;s just assume that all loads and stores</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2790"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are different (unless we have something which is guaranteed to not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2791"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// change.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2792"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (I1-&gt;mayLoadOrStore() &amp;&amp; !I1-&gt;isDereferenceableInvariantLoad())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2793"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2794"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2795"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If both instructions are loads or stores, they are equal only if both</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2796"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are dereferenceable invariant loads with the same number of bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2797"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (I1-&gt;mayLoadOrStore() &amp;&amp; I2-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a17f5d15a7320dec2cfefb6617f711ab7">mayLoadOrStore</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2798"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gloadstore">GLoadStore</a> &#42;LS1 = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GLoadStore&gt;</a>(I1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2799"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gloadstore">GLoadStore</a> &#42;LS2 = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GLoadStore&gt;</a>(I2);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2804"><Highlight kind="normal">        (LS1-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gmemoperation/#ac815a03646b3fcf26176feb2c669fb9e">getMemSizeInBits</a>() != LS2-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gmemoperation/#ac815a03646b3fcf26176feb2c669fb9e">getMemSizeInBits</a>()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2805"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2808"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for physical registers on the instructions first to avoid cases</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2809"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// like this:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2810"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2811"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %a = COPY $physreg</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SOMETHING implicit-def $physreg</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2815"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %b = COPY $physreg</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2817"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These copies are not equivalent.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2818"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61d13d6824ec46c31260a4fd0997eda0">any&#95;of</a>(I1-&gt;uses(), &#91;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp;MO) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2819"><Highlight kind="normal">        return MO.isReg() &amp;&amp; MO.getReg().isPhysical();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2820"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2821"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if we have a case like this:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2822"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2823"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %a = COPY $physreg</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2824"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %b = COPY %a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2825"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2826"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In this case, I1 and I2 will both be equal to %a = COPY $physreg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2827"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From that, we know that they must have the same value, since they must</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2828"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have come from the same COPY.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2829"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> I1-&gt;isIdenticalTo(&#42;I2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2830"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2831"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2832"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We don&#39;t have any physical registers, so we don&#39;t necessarily need the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2833"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// same vreg defs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2834"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2835"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On the off-chance that there&#39;s some target instruction feeding into the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2836"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, let&#39;s use produceSameValue instead of isIdenticalTo.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2837"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/combinerhelper/#aee882972a50054d1a691edcc470e4dc8">Builder</a>.getTII().produceSameValue(&#42;I1, &#42;I2, &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/combinerhelper/#a9fdbebed8efeedc9c2b5be88e2e33798">MRI</a>)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2838"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Handle instructions with multiple defs that produce same values. Values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2839"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are same for operands with same index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2840"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %0:&#95;(s8), %1:&#95;(s8), %2:&#95;(s8), %3:&#95;(s8) = G&#95;UNMERGE&#95;VALUES %4:&#95;(&lt;4 x s8&gt;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2841"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %5:&#95;(s8), %6:&#95;(s8), %7:&#95;(s8), %8:&#95;(s8) = G&#95;UNMERGE&#95;VALUES %4:&#95;(&lt;4 x s8&gt;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2842"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// I1 and I2 are different instructions but produce same values,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2843"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %1 and %6 are same, %1 and %7 are not the same value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2845"><Highlight kind="normal">           I2-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#aeeed341d0f3c7220d070d766e3a0f584">findRegisterDefOperandIdx</a>(InstAndDef2-&gt;Reg, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;TRI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
